title: Iran in collective shock after bloody crackdown
subhed: Even though internet access remains mostly cut off, a few openings have allowed the population to grasp the unprecedented violence unleashed on protesters: tens of thousands killed, mass arrests, hospitals under surveillance and overcrowded prisons.

title: Capgemini in turmoil over its work with ICE
Half of new immigrants in France are students or refugees
French Parliament's lessons from a monthslong budget battle
subhed: With the 2026 budget bill expected to be passed into law next week, MPs are taking stock of the long debates, hoping to draw lessons for the 2027 budget.

title: Former French senator found guilty of drugging MP with intent to sexually assault or rape
subhed: In its ruling, the Paris court found that Joël Guerriau intended to commit rape or sexual assault against MP Sandrine Josso. He was sentenced to four years prison, with 30 months suspended, a five-year ban on holding public office, and a mandatory treatment order.

title: Paris Haute Couture Week: Chanel dazzles, Armani faces new challenge
subhed: Matthieu Blazy delivered his first light and airy haute couture show for Chanel, while Armani Privé unveiled its debut collection without Giorgio Armani.
byline: By Elvire von Bardeleben and Valentin Pérez

title: Work-related cancers remain a blind spot in France's public health system
subhed: A study conducted by doctors and occupational sociologists at the Avignon Hospital Center on over 500 lymphoma patients found there was a 'massive underestimation' of work-related cancers in France.
byline: By Stéphane Foucart (Avignon, southern France, special correspondent)

title: How India and the EU created a common market to counter Trump
byline: By Carole Dieterich (New Delhi (India) correspondent) and Virginie Malingre (Brussels, Europe bureau)

Why there are so many French presidential hopefuls
subhed: As a result of political fragmentation, the growing number of figures who have declared their candidacies or are thinking about doing so is making the 2027 presidential election highly uncertain, writes Le Monde's Solenn de Royer in her column.

title: Richard Ford: 'I tell my European friends how it feels not to understand my country'
subhed: The novelist expresses concern, in an op-ed for Le Monde, about the direction his country has taken under President Donald Trump. He laments that Americans do not appear to pay attention to the erosion of their constitutional rights, nor do they grasp how difficult it will be to turn back.

title: Footage shows death of Alex Pretti, killed by US Border Patrol in Minneapolis
subhed: The 37-year-old nurse was killed Saturday after federal immigration agents fired at least 10 shots.
